Title:
Lasiodiplodia spp associated with Aquilaria crassna in
Laos
Abstract:
Lasiodiplodia spp. were isolated from trunks of healthy,
brown and ligaloes tissue of Aquilaria crassna in Laos. Thirty-four
isolates of Lasiodiplodia spp. were retrieved, which belong to twelve
taxa. Of which, eight species are new to science. Fungal identification
was conducted using a combination of morphology and multi-locus
phylogenetic analyses based on combined translation elongation factor
1-a sequence (tef1-a), internal transcribed spacer (ITS), ÃŸ-tubulin
(TUB) and RNA polymerase II beta subunit (RPB2) nuDNA sequences. Cashew
nut-shaped conidia and the baculate ornamentation on the conidia of
Lasiodiplodia spp. were first reported in this study. Aquilaria crassna
proved a good host for Lasiodiplodia, and it is estimated that there
would be more new species of Lasiodiplodia in various substrates in
tropical or subtropical area.
